abstract: Bank of America posts second-quarter net income of $4 billion. | Michael S. Dell is engaged in last-minute maneuvers over the company he founded. | Hiring a company’s former executive as a buyout adviser can present problems, the Deal Professor writes. | Paolo Pellegrini gets testy on the witness stand in the trial of Fabrice Tourre.
snippet: Bank of America posts second-quarter net income of $4 billion. | Michael S. Dell is engaged in last-minute maneuvers over the company he founded. | Hiring a company’s former executive as a buyout adviser can present problems, the Deal Professor wr...
lead_paragraph: Bank of America reported on Wednesday that its second-quarter net income rose 63 percent to $4 billion, or 32 cents a share, compared with $2.5 billion, or 19 cents a share, in the period a year earlier. Revenue increased to $22.7 billion from $22 billion in the period a year earlier. A conference call to discuss the results is being held at 8:30 a.m.
